name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

key_work.title: Gone Home
key_work.brief_description: When Katie returns home from overseas, she finds her house deserted and her family gone. That’s just one horror trope that Gone Home uses to mislead players as Katie searches the house for her family in this walking simulator.

constellations_primary.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_primary.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

start.title: Joanie 4 Jackie
start.brief_description: In 1995 Miranda July dropped out of college, moved to Portland, Oregon, and typed up a pamphlet that she imagined would be the start of a revolution of girls and women making movies and sharing them with each other. The pamphlet said: “A challenge and a promise: Lady, you send me your movie and I’ll send you the latest Big Miss Moviola Chainletter Tape.” The Joanie 4 Jackie project involved zines, chainletter tapes, co-star tapes and events.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

end.title: Madeline's Madeline

video_links.name: Madeline's Madeline - Official Trailer HD - Oscilloscope Laboratories

end.brief_description: Madeline has become an integral part of a prestigious physical theater troupe. When the workshop’s ambitious director pushes the teenager to weave her rich interior world and troubled history with her mother into their collective art, the lines between performance and reality begin to blur. The resulting battle between imagination and appropriation rips out of the rehearsal space and through all three women’s lives.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

links.description: July featured in 2018’s Madeline’s Madeline, an experimental film exploring teenage actor Madeline (Helena Howard), who experiences the blurring of boundaries between real life and the characters she inhabits.

start.title: Gone Home
start.brief_description: When Katie returns home from overseas, she finds her house deserted and her family gone. That’s just one horror trope that Gone Home uses to mislead players as Katie searches the house for her family in this walking simulator.

constellations_primary.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_primary.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

end.title: My So-Called Life
end.creator_credit: Alan Poul, Scott Winant, Marshall Herskovitz and Edward Zwick
end.brief_description: The life of a 15 year-old high school student, whose angst-ridden journey through adolescence, friendship, parents, and life teaches her what it means to grow up.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

links.description: In crafting the characters of Katie and Samantha in Gone Home, the team were very influenced by the realistic portrayal of 1990s teen life in short-lived drama My So Called Life.

start.title: Gone Home
start.brief_description: When Katie returns home from overseas, she finds her house deserted and her family gone. That’s just one horror trope that Gone Home uses to mislead players as Katie searches the house for her family in this walking simulator.

end.title: Joanie 4 Jackie
end.brief_description: In 1995 Miranda July dropped out of college, moved to Portland, Oregon, and typed up a pamphlet that she imagined would be the start of a revolution of girls and women making movies and sharing them with each other. The pamphlet said: “A challenge and a promise: Lady, you send me your movie and I’ll send you the latest Big Miss Moviola Chainletter Tape.” The Joanie 4 Jackie project involved zines, chainletter tapes, co-star tapes and events.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

links.description: Gone Home is set in Portland, 1995, and features zines and Riot Grrrl music. Miranda July moved to Portland in 1995, and began Joanie 4 Jackie initially known as ‘Big Miss Moviola’, a feminist film project featuring artists and bands from the area.

start.title: My So-Called Life
start.creator_credit: Alan Poul, Scott Winant, Marshall Herskovitz and Edward Zwick
start.brief_description: The life of a 15 year-old high school student, whose angst-ridden journey through adolescence, friendship, parents, and life teaches her what it means to grow up.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

end.title: Romeo + Juliet
end.creator_credit: Catherine Martin, Baz Luhrmann, Martin Brown, Gabriella Martinelli and Jill Bilcock
end.brief_description: In director Baz Luhrmann’s contemporary take on William Shakespeare’s classic tragedy, the Montagues and Capulets have moved their ongoing feud to the sweltering suburb of Verona Beach, where Romeo and Juliet fall in love and secretly wed. Though the film is visually modern, the bard’s dialogue remains.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

constellations_other.name: Shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

constellations_other.name: Warwick Thornton
constellations_other.description: Brimming with Shakespearean undertones and pathos, Kaytetye filmmaker Warwick Thornton's debut feature Samson and Delilah is both a universal tale and one intrinsically tied to the experience of First Peoples in Central Australia.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

links.description: Claire Danes, fresh from her role on My So Called Life, would go on to play Juliet in Baz Lurhmann’s take on the Shakespearian teen tragedy Romeo + Juliet.

start.title: Romeo + Juliet
start.creator_credit: Catherine Martin, Baz Luhrmann, Martin Brown, Gabriella Martinelli and Jill Bilcock
start.brief_description: In director Baz Luhrmann’s contemporary take on William Shakespeare’s classic tragedy, the Montagues and Capulets have moved their ongoing feud to the sweltering suburb of Verona Beach, where Romeo and Juliet fall in love and secretly wed. Though the film is visually modern, the bard’s dialogue remains.

end.title: The Basketball Diaries
end.creator_credit: Liz Heller and John Bard Manulis
end.brief_description: A high school basketball player’s life turns upside down after free-falling into the harrowing world of drug addiction.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.

links.description: Just prior to taking up the role of Romeo, Leonardo DiCaprio played a teen of a different kind in his frank portrayal of teen heroin addict in The Basketball Diaries.
